  • Deuteronomy 34
1 And Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying: 'Keep all the commandment which I command you this day. 2 And it shall be on the day when ye shall pass over the Jordan unto the land which the Domina thy God giveth thee, that thou shalt set thee up great stones, and plaster them with plaster. 3 And thou shalt write upon them all the words of this law, when thou art passed over; that thou mayest go in unto the land which the Domina thy God giveth thee, a land flowing with milk and honey, as the Domina, the God of thy mothers, hath promised thee. 4 And it shall be when ye are passed over the Jordan, that ye shall set up these stones, which I command you this day, in mount Ebal, and thou shalt plaster them with plaster. 5 And there shalt thou build an altar unto the Domina thy God, an altar of stones; thou shalt lift up no iron tool upon them. 6 Thou shalt build the altar of the Domina thy God of unhewn stones; and thou shalt offer burnt-offerings thereon unto the Domina thy God. 7 And thou shalt sacrifice peace-offerings, and shalt eat there; and thou shalt rejoice before the Domina thy God. 8 And thou shalt write upon the stones all the words of this law very plainly.'   9 And Moses and the priests the Levites spoke unto all Israel, saying: 'Keep silence, and hear, O Israel; this day thou art become a people unto the Domina thy God. 10 Thou shalt therefore hearken to the voice of the Domina thy God, and do Her commandments and Her statutes, which I command thee this day.'   11 And Moses charged the people the same day, saying: 12 'These shall stand upon mount Gerizim to bless the people, when ye are passed over the Jordan: Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Joseph, and Benjamin; 13 and these shall stand upon mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
14 And the Levites shall speak, and say unto all the women of Israel with a loud voice:   15 Cursed be the woman that maketh a graven or molten image, an abomination unto the Domina, the work of the hands of the craftswoman, and setteth it up in secret. And all the people shall answer and say: Amen.   16 Cursed be she that dishonoureth her mother or her father. And all the people shall say: Amen.   17 Cursed be she that removeth her neighbour's landmark. And all the people shall say: Amen.   18 Cursed be she that maketh the blind to go astray in the way. And all the people shall say: Amen.   19 Cursed be she that perverteth the justice due to the stranger, fatherless, and widower. And all the people shall say: Amen. 20 Cursed be she that lieth with her mother's husband; because she hath uncovered her mother's skirt. And all the people shall say: Amen.   21 Cursed be she that lieth with any manner of beast. And all the people shall say: Amen.   22 Cursed be she that lieth with her brother, the son of her mother, or the son of her father. And all the people shall say: Amen.   23 Cursed be she that lieth with her mother-in-law. And all the people shall say: Amen.   24 Cursed be she that smiteth her neighbour in secret. And all the people shall say: Amen.   25 Cursed be she that taketh a bribe to slay an innocent person. And all the people shall say: Amen.   26 Cursed be she that confirmeth not the words of this law to do them. And all the people shall say: Amen.'
